website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus M.Zuiko Digital 17mm f1.8 is a fast wide-angle lens for Micro Four Thirds cameras. It's extremely sharp, and doesn't cost an arm and a leg.

customer_reviews.title: A worthy alternative to the kit zoom lens
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful little prime lens for the Micro Four Thirds system, roughly equivalent to 35mm on Full Frame. Build quality is excellent, with a metal barrel and lens mount, and an encouragingly positive clunk to the mechanism that disengages the AF clutch to put you into MF territory. Low light performance is great, decent bokeh and sharp throughout. Olympus OM-D and PEN cameras have Image Stabilisation built into the camera bodies, so bear in mind there'll be no IS on for e.g. a Panasonic body. It's my goto lens for use with both my PEN F and EPL-7, and a more than worthy alternative to the kit zoom lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: A fast 'prime' ~ medium wide-angle lens for Olympus or Lumix
customer_reviews.text: The one niggle I have about this otherwise delightful Micro Four-Thirds lens is the lack of an auto-focus feature common to all other lenses acquired for my main photo-taking system (Lumix and Olympus compact SLRs). You should therefore measure or judge 'nearer to camera' distances with greatest care, to ensure sharp focus, especially in low-light situations.
customer_reviews.author: Roger C. Chartres

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Small sharp and very versatile lens. Best one I use for general purpose photography.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Dahlgren

customer_reviews.title: An excellent lens which works well with the OM-D 5 ii
customer_reviews.text: An excellent lens which works well with the OM-D 5 ii. Light and effective it is very useful for street photos.
customer_reviews.author: TerryN

customer_reviews.title: Good for street photography and landscape
customer_reviews.text: Lovely little lens. I use it as my prime of choice. Good for street photography and landscape.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph E Aldhous

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer
customer_reviews.text: Early days but so far it hasn't disappointed. Still a bit new to the whole m4/3s thing which I've got into as a lighter weight travel alternative to my Nikon gear and this 17mm prime is so small and light you wouldn't leave it behind even though I also have a 14-150mm zoom that covers this focal length though a couple of stops slower. I've read that some people say this lens isn't particularly sharp but my copy seems to be fine.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect couple
customer_reviews.text: The lens feels very good and the picture quality is absolutely amazing. The Olympus OM-D EM5II with the 17mm Zuiko lens are my favourite travel couple. Very light with high quality and if you like to make street photography you'll get amazing results.
customer_reviews.author: Pammy1140

customer_reviews.title: Brilliantly sharp, sturdy built lens.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliantly sharp, sturdy built lens. Well worth the money. I very much like the manual focus system on this lens and even though it's still focus by wire it's very close to a good directly connected system.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens use on my Olympus Pen E5
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens use on my Olympus Pen E5, some slight distortion at edges but hardly noticable, and good enough for my agents to sell my photos using this product!
customer_reviews.author: toto

customer_reviews.title: Good but watch your ISO
customer_reviews.text: Super Sharp, super fast focus. Everything in the main web reviews is accurate except I read it is really kind to high iso but I found the opposite on an Oly EP5. Struggles to look good over 1600
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens, keep it on my camera 90% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: James Walley

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for general photo
customer_reviews.text: Compact, fast and sharp. Great lens for general photo. Barrel distortion is obvious if you try to do a close portrait. Should come with hood since it loses some contrast when the sun hits from the side
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Camacho

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful lens
customer_reviews.text: Superb quality and excellence even in low light. It is not weatherproof otherwise it would be perfect. A must if you own a Micro 4/3.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carlo

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: This Lens is amazing, the photo quality is excellent but the video quality is even better, shoots really well in low light conditions - my favourite lens I have bought in the last few years
customer_reviews.author: AJ_Ullah

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic lens that really comes into it's own for close-up ...
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic lens that really comes into it's own for close-up photography. Crisp, sharp images and helping me to take some of the best photo's I've ever taken. Excellent all-round
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: I really like my 45mm f1.8 but now this 17mm is always on my camera as it's so useful. It has a good weight, looks great on my EM 5 and I'm really happy with the sharpness. I can't fault this lens but I did have to buy a lens hood for it from Amazon. If you have an EM5, just watch how you have set up your manual focus as so far, I don't see any use for the manual focus on the lens as you can't see an enlarged view in the viewfinder. Will have to read the user manual again. Very happy with my purchase and a great price from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Little Lens
customer_reviews.text: What a great little lens! Beautifully made and pin sharp even wide open although stopping it down to f4 makes it even better! I'm so impressed with this little lens, it's a joy to use. I took some shots of my grandson in his back garden last Sunday from a fair distance and on heavy cropping I found that he was still pin sharp. This lens will probably be my walk about lens in future. As a plus point it is less intimidating when pointing the camera in the direction of complete strangers!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gordon Downie

customer_reviews.title: Really solid lens
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a prime which doesn't take up too much room, and which delivers good quality. The camera (OM-D EM5) and the lens far out perform my limited skills, but I am getting there. Lightweight, easy carry package allows me to use the camera whenever I wish to. Good results thus far IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Stecks

customer_reviews.title: It's a brilliant lens, but there comes a point when you ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a brilliant lens, but there comes a point when you think do I want to spend 349 £ on this non zoomable lens or maybe add extra 300 and buy a pro lens.. so for me I have the pancake lens and this , the pro lens would have done more good for me , for every purpose that I need it for . Except from the above it is a nice lens
customer_reviews.author: abiola

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably small, but with top Image Quality
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding performance from such an incredibly small lens. Well made (metal construction), very smooth focussing ring. It was my first Olympus lens for my Pen F, and I was blown away by the size of it. Performance on a par with many bulky DSLR prime lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for fairly wide angle work
customer_reviews.text: Optically superb this little lense works faultlessly. It's very bright and with the f stop wide open the depth of field is very narrow. Stop it down and the sharpness across the frame is consistently good. It's a good all rounder if you like primes. It matches the 45 and 75 well. Equiv to a 35mm on a full frame camera I'd say.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart C

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best lenses for a traveller that wants to capture the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time i but this lenses. Unfortunently, the first one was stolen. This is by far the best lenses for a traveller that wants to capture the moment in an instante. Fast focus and a really good apperture make this my favourite travelling lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Joana Nunes

product_meta.title: Olympus M.Zuiko Digital 17 mm F1.8 Lens, Fast Fixed Focal Length, Suitable for All MFT Cameras (Olympus OM-D & PEN Models, Panasonic G-Series), Silver
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:SilverGreat image quality in a lightweight and highly compact format: the M.Zuiko Digital 17 mm (34 mm*) lens has a large, very fast F1.8 aperture, ideal for shooting without a tripod in low light conditions. With the enhanced MSC (Movie and Stills Compatible) autofocus and special ZERO coating, you can achieve exactly the high-quality results you want.

BOX CONTAINS
Olympus M.ZUIKO DIGITAL 17mm 1:1.8
LC-46 Lens Cap
Micro Four Thirds lens rear cap (LR-2)
Warranty Card
Operating Instructions
feature_bullets: Ideally suited for: Landscape, travel, nature, low-light and architecture, portrait - equivalent to a 34 mm 35 mm lens
The 17 mm wide angle with a large F1.8 f-stop is ideal for shooting in low light
Sliding focus ring allows quick change between autofocus and manual focus
The slim design and robust metal housing of the lens impresses with its compact lightness
Outstanding image quality, despite very compact design with pin-sharp images right up to the edges of the image
Ideal finish, high quality metal bayonet and ideal close-up limit for macro photography
Package contents: Lens, LC-72C lens cap, LH-76 lens hood, LSC-1120 lens bag, LR-2 lens cap MFT (rear), operating instructions

specifications.Included Components: Olympus M.ZUIKO DIGITAL 17mm 1:1.8, LC-46 Lens Cap, Micro Four Thirds lens rear cap
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars207 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
